headline: Norwegian Cruise Line (NCLH): $272.5M One-Off Loss Challenges Bullish Profit Growth Narratives
summary: Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings (NCLH) posted a net profit margin of 6.8%, an improvement from 5.9% a year earlier, with EPS climbing 20.8% over the past year. This is well above its five-year compound earnings growth of 59.2% per year. Shares trade at $18.79, notably below both the company's estimated fair value of $44.91 and even the most conservative analyst price targets, giving the valuation an attractive edge relative to industry benchmarks. While profitability momentum remains robust,...
